org.aoplib4j.modularity.internal
Class AbstractBoundary

java.lang.Object
  org.aoplib4j.modularity.internal.AbstractBoundary
Direct Known Subclasses:
ClassBoundaryAspect, PackageBoundaryAspect
abstract class AbstractBoundary
extends java.lang.Object

Abstract class containing the common behavior for the package modularity and class modularity aspects.

Author:
Adrian Citu

Parameters:

classBoundary - the class boundary annotation (if applicable)
pkgBoundary - the package boundary annotation (if applicable)
calledMethod - the called method
callerSte - the caller stacke trace.

createCallBackInstance

private BoundaryViolationCallback createCallBackInstance(Aoplib4jClassBoundary classBoundary,
                                                         Aoplib4jPackageBoundary pkgBoundary)
                                                  throws java.lang.InstantiationException,
                                                         java.lang.IllegalAccessException
Creates an instance of boundary violation callback using the information from the Aoplib4jClassBoundary.callbackClass() or from the Aoplib4jPackageBoundary.callbackClass().

Parameters:
classBoundary - the Aoplib4jClassBoundary annotation.
pkgBoundary - the Aoplib4jPackageBoundary annotation.
Returns:
instance of a BoundaryViolationCallback.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalAccessException - if the instantiation fails (introspection is used)
java.lang.InstantiationException - if the instantiation fails (introspection is used)
See Also:
BoundaryViolationCallback

getCallerInformation

java.lang.StackTraceElement getCallerInformation(java.lang.String calledClassName,
                                                 java.lang.String calledMethodName)
Method that computes the information about the caller class. The information is stored into a StackTraceElement object. Normally the caller information is on the third position on the stack trace but the stack trace can be modified by the weaving of an aspect (see http://code.google.com/p/aoplib4j/issues/detail?id=75). So the method returns the first entry from the stacktrace that do not have as package name org.aoplib4j.modularity.internal. ;the first position contains the call to this method, and the second one to the ClassBoundaryAspect.callOfStaticClassBoundaryAdvice( org.aspectj.lang.JoinPoint.StaticPart) or PackageBoundaryAspect.callOfStaticPackageBoundaryAdvice( org.aspectj.lang.JoinPoint.StaticPart) This method will return faulty results when a child class calls an inherited non overridden parent method. In this case the stack trace contains a call to the parent method directly. 
  Example:
  P - parent class 
  P#method - a method of the parent
  C - child class; it does not override the "method" method
  
  On the stack trace a call to C#method is in fact written as a call to
  P#method.

Parameters:
calledClassName - the canonical name of the called class name
calledMethodName - the name of the called method.
Returns:
StackTraceElement represented the caller method.

createAndExecuteCallback

void createAndExecuteCallback(java.lang.Object calledObj,
                              java.lang.Object callerObj,
                              org.aspectj.lang.JoinPoint jp,
                              Aoplib4jPackageBoundary pkgBoundary,
                              Aoplib4jClassBoundary classBoundary)
Method that will create a callback class using information from the Aoplib4jClassBoundary or Aoplib4jPackageBoundary and execute the callback by calling BoundaryViolationCallback.boundaryViolation(ViolationInformation) .

Parameters:
calledObj - the called object
callerObj - the caller object
jp - aspectj joinpoint
pkgBoundary - package boundary annotation (if applicable)
classBoundary - class boundary annotation (if applicable)

searchStringIntoArray

boolean searchStringIntoArray(java.lang.String stringTolook,
                              ListType listType,
                              java.lang.String[] stringArray)
Parameters:
stringTolook - the string to look for
listType - the type of list
stringArray - the array of string on which the search should be done
Returns:
true if the stringArray is a ListType.BLACKLIST and the stringToLook is present into the array. false if the stringArray is a ListType.WHITELIST and the stringToLook is present into the array.
